items.title: ICE bought vehicles equipped with fake cell towers to spy on phones
items.summary: The federal contract shows ICE spent $825,000 on vans equipped with “cell-site simulators” which allow the real-world location tracking of nearby phones and their owners.

items.title: Govee’s Matter-ready Permanent Outdoor Lights Pro start from a $280 low during Prime Day (Reg. $439+), more from $10
items.summary:
As part of Amazon’s ongoing Prime Big Deal Days event, Govee’s official storefront is offering up to 54% discounts across its lineup of indoor and outdoor smart ambient lighting devices. One notable drop during this sale is the 200-foot Permanent Outdoor Lights Pro back at $479.99 shipped for the second-ever time, while its 100 and 150-foot models are also down at returning lows starting from $279.99 shipped. Normally fetching $760 without price cuts, we’ve seen discounts mostly keeping this model at $600 over the year, with previous one-time falls to $560 and the $480 low, which was during July’s Prime Day event. Now, while these 37% savings last, you can bring home the most extensive of the brand’s pro-tier outdoor lighting for a second-ever chance at the lowest price we have tracked.

items.title: Surging Nile waters inundate Egypt and Sudan, revive dispute over Ethiopian mega-dam
items.summary: CAIRO (Reuters) -Rising Nile waters inundated homes and fields in northern Egypt over the weekend, forcing residents to move by boat and intensifying a war of words between Cairo and Addis Ababa over whether Ethiopia's giant Nile dam has worsened seasonal floods. Read full story

You can also get this in white, though it’s currently fetching $33.99 shipped with a relatively lighter 32% discount. This is regularly a $50 model, which is now seeing a whopping 56% markdown. Today’s deal shaves $28 off its usual going rate, landing it $3 below the lowest price we first tracked for the white one during the previous Prime Day sale earlier this year. It’s a good option to consider if you’re looking to step up your Android gaming experience, and you can learn more about it in detail below.

items.summary:
As part of its Fall Prime Day Sale, Segway is saving folks hundreds of dollars on EVs, with some notable discounts on the e-bikes, specifically, that deserve some spotlight time. During this short-term sale, you can hop on the Xafari e-bike at $1,999.99 shipped, while the more advanced Xyber e-bike is down at $2,900 shipped. These newer releases normally fetch $2,400 and $3,300 at full price, with the discounts we have seen in their short time on the market being scarce and only going as low as $2,000 and $3,000. Today’s deal sees the return of the Xafari’s $400 markdown, while the Xyber is getting a larger-than-ever $400 markdown to match, landing them at their return and new lowest prices to date.

items.title: Segway is offering up to $410 in Navimow Prime Day savings on robot mowers with FREE gear starting from new $699 low
items.summary:
Segway Navimow is offering up to $410 in Prime Big Deal Days savings on its i series of robot mowers, which is partially coming in the form of FREE gear. You’ll find the brand’s i105 Robot Lawn Mower down at $899 shipped, while the i110 Robot Lawn Mower is going for $1,099 shipped – with both models getting a free Garage S add-on (valued at $200) alongside purchases. On the flip side, at Amazon, you can find the i105 robot at $699 shipped, and the i110 robot at $909 shipped, but without the free add-on gear. These two autonomous helpers normally run for $999 and $1,299 at full price, with the i110 model having only been discounted to this same rate over 2025, aside from the one-time $999 low from July, while the i105 model has dropped as low as $749, also last seen in July. You’re looking at the second-best price on the i110 and third-best price on the i105, and some of the largest overall savings that we’ve tracked over the year – for the bundled options. Going with Amazon scores you two new all-time low prices.
